item.title: “MMeM”: Modeling the Multivariate Mixed-effects
item.description:
Statistical Intuition The univariate mixed-effects model The multivariate mixed-effects model An Implementation Example Initialization Estimation I co-developed an R pakcage “MMeM” for estimating the variance-covariance matrix of random effects \(\mathbf{u}\) and \(\mathbf{e}\) on multiple dependent variables.
Statistical Intuition The univariate mixed-effects model In univariate mixed-effects model: \(\mathbf{y} = \mathbf{Xb} + \mathbf{Zu} + \mathbf{e}\) (1), we estimate the variance component \(\sigma_u^2\) and \(\sigma_e^2\) for \(\mathbf{u} \sim N(\mathbf{0}, \sigma_u^2\mathbf{I})\) and \(\mathbf{e} \sim N(\mathbf{0}, \sigma_e^2\mathbf{I})\).

item.title: “regrrr”: One-stop R-toolkit for Compiling Regression Results
item.description:
Installation Examples compile the correlation table compile the regression table plot the moderating effect Today, I released an R package “regrrr” on Cran. In strategy/management research, we always need to compile the regression results into the publishable format and sometimes plot the moderating effects. This package does the job. Here is the quickstart guide.

item.title: A Quick Bibliometric Analysis on “Positioning”
item.description: I had a whim and wanted to do some quick bibliometric analysis on the topic of “strategic positioning”. The raw data is extracted from Web of Science. The search parameters: TITLE: ("strategic positioning" OR "industry positioning" OR "market positioning") Refined by: WEB OF SCIENCE CATEGORIES: ( MANAGEMENT OR BUSINESS OR ECONOMICS ) AND WEB OF SCIENCE CATEGORIES: ( MANAGEMENT OR BUSINESS OR INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS OR ECONOMICS ) AND DOCUMENT TYPES: ( ARTICLE ) AND LANGUAGES: ( ENGLISH ) Timespan: All years.
